Teaching

Here is a list of all courses that I am teaching or have taught since 2019/20. I usually teach methodological courses.

Course Teaching

University of Zurich

  • 06SM200m800b: Dirty Data: Outliers and Missing Values in Statistics and Psychology
    Graduate level (MSc Psychology), offered annualy since spring 2025, 4 ECTS. I taught, coordinated, and newly developed this course.
    Click here for course evaluations.

  • 06TT200-001a: Tutorials Statistics I (Part I)
    Undergraduate level (BSc Psychology), annualy since fall 2025, 12 ECTS (in German). Role: coordination and administration of the tutorials of this large first-year undergraduate course (> 700 students) on the essentials of statistics.
    My role in this course was not evaluated.

Erasmus University Rotterdam

  • FEM3100: Machine Learning
    Graduate level (MSc Econometrics), fall 2022, 4 ECTS. Role: lecturer (one out of four lecturers).
    My role in this course was not evaluated.

  • FEB23020: Seminar in Machine Learning
    Undergraduate level (BSc Econometrics), annually from 2022–24, 12 ECTS. Role: lecturer (supervision of group projects).
    Unfortunately, the groups I supervised did not evaluate this course.

  • FEB23012: Seminar in Econometrics
    Undergraduate level (BSc Econometrics), spring 2021 (online), 12 ECTS. Role: lecturer (supervision of group projects).
    Unfortunately, the groups I supervised did not evaluate this course.

  • FEB22015X: Academic Skills (Econometrics)
    Undergraduate level (BSc Econometrics), spring 2021 (online), 4 ECTS. Role: teaching assistant.
    Click here for a snapshot of the evaluation of my tutorials (5-point scale with 5 = best).

  • FEB21018X: Introduction to Statistics
    Undergraduate level (BSc Econometrics), spring 2021 (online), 6 ECTS. Role: IT support during the pandemic.
    My role in this course was not evaluated.

  • FEB2003X: Introduction to Multivariate Statistics
    Undergraduate level (BSc Econometrics), fall 2019, 4 ECTS. Role: teaching assistant.
    Click here for a snapshot of the evaluation of my tutorials (5-point scale with 5 = best).

Thesis Supervision

University of Zurich (degrees in psychology)

  • 1 bachelor thesis as main supervisor
  • 2 master theses as main supervisor (among which one is ongoing as of January ‘26)

Erasmus University (degrees in econometrics)

  • 12 bachelor theses as main supervisor, 14 as second assessor
  • 3 master theses as main supervisor, 7 as second assessor
